[Continued] The boy C-Ding came seeking fire.
He then asked, "What's the fire that burns the face of the Buddha?
There were three buddhas in the past, present, and future.
They won't part from it to turn the wheel of the Dharma.'
(Yefuchuan).
"The boy C-Ding came seeking fire.
In the south, C and D are also fires.
What can the Xiangtan master do?
It's nothing more than your bottom-of-mind desire.
(Manjuan Yan).
Once I fell down drunk in front of the jade palace.
His eyebrows were tangled, his hair was tied up, and he laughed and confused.
It's the most annoying part that breaks people's intestines.
I borrowed my wife's robe to pay my respects to her in her year.
(Wanshan Ning).
What I saw in the past wasn't real.
What we see now is not false.
The sutra was written three times.
"How could a crow become a horse?
(Jewel-leaf Source).

source_sentence: 杭州永明開山道潛禪師。
translation: Daoxian Chanshi, from Yongming's founding in Hangzhou.
(He succeeded Hōan.) He first consulted Hōan.
He said.
"My son asked me to come outside.
What sūtra does he read?
He said the Flower Ornament.
He said it's the same, general, distinct, and six phases of formation and disintegration.
What teaching does it incorporate?
The teacher said.
"All dharmas in the world and beyond are endowed with the six phases.
They all have the six characteristics.
He asked, "Does emptiness have the six characteristics?
The teacher had no answer.
He said, "Why don't you ask about it?
The teacher then asked.
"Does emptiness have the six characteristics?
He said, "Emptiness.
The teacher then became enlightened.
He said, "What did you do to make this happen?
The teacher said, "It's empty.
The eye approves of it.
He spoke a verse.
"Emptiness is empty, and there's no back side.
Picking it up, he revealed that it was in two pieces.
The eaves face south toward the head of Ping Shan.
For a thousand years and tens of thousands of years, few people have seen it.
Do you want to see it?

source_sentence: (以拂子打圓相云)金烏飛上琉璃殿。
translation: (He struck the shape of the circle with his whisk, saying, "The golden crow flies up to the lapis lazuli palace.")
(Gwangyulun).

source_sentence: 禪宗頌古聯珠通集卷第三十七
translation: Chanzong chansong lianzhu tongji vol. 37
